history.text: Hello
User 2: are you there?
The Movie we are talking about right now is Home Alone, Have you seen it?
I am not sure
Is it a recent movie
Its a 90's American comedy from John Huges staring Macaulay Culkin
I think there was more than 1 of that movie series, some I saw, some I did not
is this the 1st one
This is the Original where the Family mistakenly leaves him Home while taking a trip to Paris for their Christmas Vacation
I don't think I saw that one, I remember one about being lost in a big City, NY or LA
what happens in the original movie
Basically the same cast with Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern trying to break into the family home, Obviously being foiled by the youngster in a hilarious way
Joe Pesci I like, mostly from gangster movies
Stern I am not real familiar with
Very good comedy duo, You should watch it
Pesci Plays Harry and Stern Plays Marv, do you like Comedies?
What ever happened to these guys, Pesci I have not seen in a long time.  And M. Culkin, did he ever do anything other than this series of movies
I have no idea, While the movie was scored low by critics it did well enough to get more movies LOL
Do you know if home alone is available on Netflex or the other streaming outlets
I do not know,
Joe pesci is 75 and alive, but no recent credits listed
Culkin, now looks pretty odd by what I just looked up on IMBD
But maybe that was a role he is playing
There is also another guy in the movie that played Gus... "the Polka King"... He was funny and helped the Mother get back to Kid
Gus, that is John cabdy, he died a few years back, overdose I think
John CANDY
He Did a good Job in the Movie, Poor Lady had to Listen to that Polka music though LOL
I looked on my Roku, and Home Alone is available to rent, but not free on any of the channels.
It's a Christmas movie, always out on TV for free around then
too much other free stuff, so I would need to be convinced it is worth the $2.99
or wait until next Christmas like you said
You get to see the Original, He rigs up the whole house, Numerous traps that hurt the Burglars in Original ways
John Candy was very funny, but he like a lot of other of his generation comedians was pretty self destructive, such as
The Burglars call themselves the Wet banits in that one
John Belusi, overdose
No drugs in this one LOL
Chris Farley too
Ok, I am going to sign off now, I will catch the movie at xmas time

uid2response.feedback: he convinced me that when the movie is out on TV around Christmas time (xmas movie) it is funny and worth watching
